@graph.name: Nora Cooks
@graph.description: The Food You Love Made Vegan

@graph.caption: Freezer Whole Grain Pancakes- Made with spelt flour and rolled oats. Super fluffy and satisfying!

@graph.name: Freezer Whole Grain Pancakes - Nora Cooks
@graph.description: These Freezer Whole Grain Pancakes are oh so fluffy and satisfying. Freeze the leftovers for a quick, easy and delicious breakfast all week long!

recipeInstructions.text: First, combine your dry ingredients in a large bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: First, combine your dry ingredients in a large bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Next, whisk together all wet ingredients in a medium bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Next, whisk together all wet ingredients in a medium bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour wet mixture into dry, and mix until combined. Try not to over mix. You may need more liquid depending on the flour you use. If the mixture is too thick, add a little water.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour wet mixture into dry, and mix until combined. Try not to over mix. You may need more liquid depending on the flour you use. If the mixture is too thick, add a little water.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a pancake griddle or other large pan over medium heat. You might need to spray your pan with a little oil so they don’t stick. When hot, drop small ladle fulls (about 1/3 cup) on to the pan. When bubbles appear, flip the pancake over and cook for a few more minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a pancake griddle or other large pan over medium heat. You might need to spray your pan with a little oil so they don’t stick. When hot, drop small ladle fulls (about 1/3 cup) on to the pan. When bubbles appear, flip the pancake over and cook for a few more minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot with maple syrup, nut butter, blueberries or banana.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve hot with maple syrup, nut butter, blueberries or banana.

recipeInstructions.text: Freeze leftovers: Place cooled pancakes in freezer ziploc bags, seal tightly and place in the freezer. Should keep for at least a month. When ready to serve, pull frozen pancake out of bag, and either microwave for 1-2 minutes or warm in a toaster until heated through.
recipeInstructions.name: Freeze leftovers: Place cooled pancakes in freezer ziploc bags, seal tightly and place in the freezer. Should keep for at least a month. When ready to serve, pull frozen pancake out of bag, and either microwave for 1-2 minutes or warm in a toaster until heated through.
